entities.name: defense against the dark arts
entities.description: The subject being discussed in the context of Hogwarts.

entities.name: minister
entities.description: The position responsible for providing on-the-ground feedback about what's really happening at Hogwarts.

entities.name: hogwarts high inquisitor
entities.description: A new position created by the Ministry to inspect educators and ensure they are meeting standards.

entities.name: professor umbridge
entities.description: The person who has been offered the position of Hogwarts High Inquisitor in addition to her teaching post.

entities.name: dumbledore
entities.description: The headmaster of Hogwarts being subjected to fair and objective evaluation by the Ministry.

entities.name: hogwarts
entities.description: The school where Defense Against the Dark Arts is taught and where the Minister's new moves have received enthusiastic support from parents.

entities.name: lucius malfoy
entities.description: A parent of students at Hogwarts who feels easier in his mind now that Dumbledore is being subjected to fair and objective evaluation by the Ministry.

entities.name: weasley
entities.description: The person who said this is an exciting new phase in the Minister's plan to get to grips with what some are calling the 'falling standards' at Hogwarts.

relationships.description: The Ministry has formalized the position of Hogwarts High Inquisitor and appointed Professor Umbridge to this role.
Weasley said that this is an exciting new phase in the Minister's plan to get to grips with what some are calling the 'falling standards' at Hogwarts.
Lucius Malfoy said that he feels much easier in his mind now that he knows Dumbledore is being subjected to fair and objective evaluation by the Ministry.
Dumbledore is being subjected to fair and objective evaluation by the Hogwarts High Inquisitor, Professor Umbridge.
